column4: [joke]  hey guys, can somebody confirm this is an authentic Micro$hit windows bootscreen http://img175.echo.cx/img175/9849/lh16bit5oq.jpg
only in the shell or also in the desktop?
I just add export something=sonething at bottom of ~/.bashrc?
well, before any exit statements of course...
did you get  "Initializing modules" fails after you upgraded to breezy?
gpg --keyserver subkeys.pgp.net --recv-keys 1135D466  times out, any other way o import the gpg?
one last question, it is normal to get: "Ign" http://mirror.ubuntulinux.nl breezy-seveas Release.gpg
do you get warnings about unauthenticated packages?
no, I did apt-get update a second time and it works fine now. I imported the gpg file
